key_points: Dignitaries including former presidents, lawmakers, and governors have arrived at the Capitol for Joe Biden's inauguration.
The ceremony is taking place on a chilly but sunny day, with the U.S. Marine Band playing.
Invited guests are seated in widely spaced chairs for COVID-19 safety, surrounded by security measures.
Former President Barack Obama and South Carolina Rep. James Clyburn were seen greeting each other.
Congressional leaders and other notable figures have taken their places on the platform.
Alex Rodriguez attended the ceremony, as Jennifer Lopez is set to perform.
Donald Trump is the first departing commander-in-chief since 1869 to skip his successor's swearing-in.
Vice President Mike Pence and former President George W. Bush are among the Republicans in attendance.
Former President Jimmy Carter is the only former president not participating in the ceremony.
Former GOP senator Jeff Flake commented on the importance of the peaceful transfer of power and Biden's presidency.
spokespersons: Jeff Flake (former GOP senator from Arizona)
